item.title: How to load data from SQL Server to Pandas Dataframe in Python
item.description: Here is the way of building connections between SQL Server and Python. Then import data from SQL Server to Pandas Dataframe. import pyodbc import pandas as pd conn = pyodbc.connect('Driver={SQL Server};' 'Server=localhost;' 'Database=DataBase;' 'Trusted_Connection=yes;') query = "select * from DataBase.dbo.annual_demand" df = pd.read_sql(query, conn) conn.close()

item.title: How to reset R environment | 如何清理R的工作环境
item.description: As part of best practice, cleaning the R environment before running the code is suggested. The following code will remove all variables and unload all libraries. 作为最佳实践的一部分，在运行R的程序之前建议首先重置R的工作环境。下面的程序会清空R的所有变量以及程序库。 # Clear environment of variables and functions rm(list = ls(all = TRUE)) # Clear environmet of packages if(is.null(sessionInfo()$otherPkgs) == FALSE)lapply(paste("package:", names(sessionInfo()$otherPkgs), sep=""), detach, character.only = TRUE, unload = TRUE)

item.title: How to randomly sample the data from a table
item.description: If your table is too large for effective processing, you may want to use a randomly selected subset of data from your original table. Example code: USE AdventureWorks2012 ; GO select count(*) from Person.Person SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Person.Person TABLESAMPLE (10 PERCENT); Data Source: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms189108(v=sql.105).aspx

The Application of CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) in Architecture Design
item.description: Karamay is on the most north west side of China. The city is famous for its extreme cold and windy winter. To design a comfort external space for local resident to work or exercise outside during the winter, we leverage the technology of CFD (computational fluid dynamics) to simulate air movement in the district. With the simulation result, we can modify the building and courtyard’s shape to intervene the air flow to avoid wind corridor and air static area.
